author.bio: I suffer from the heartbreak of re-revitiligo. A tragic congenital condition that causes my skin to be deficient in soul giving melanin, making me appear pale and lifeless, like a caucasian.
author.bio_html: I suffer from the heartbreak of re-revitiligo. A tragic congenital condition that causes my skin to be deficient in soul giving melanin, making me appear pale and lifeless, like a caucasian.

body:
There appears to be a rabid fanbase for this technically unimpressive and very dated looking game. Wondered why so many people seem so obsessed with it. And as far as I can tell they have both an ideological AND sexual fixation on these characters. Characters that are all different species and implicitly non human, but seem to be portrayed as sexual interests to one another, (regardless of gender or species,) in UTs inexplicably massive fanbase. In Undertale, (Under-tail...?) anthropomorphic animals are apparently fucking monsters and wisecracking skeletons... But don't worry! Its all good clean fun for young children!

Whenever something attacks you, see if it wants to fuck! When you encounter extreme mental illness, offer empathy and support instead of trying to explain that there's clearly something wrong with them. Bring down the patriarchy! The only thing holding us back from a perfect sexually open pan-species society!

Also I'm pretty sure the main character is in grade school, so... Double eww.

title: So Undertale is SJW/LGBT/Communist propaganda for kids?

body:
What the fuck. If people are rule34'ing undertale, okay whatever... they're gross and I wouldn't be surprised if the fanbase was full of pedos since they're on reddit, but have you played the game? 

There's a dog couple that are in love and the skeleton that you can flirt with is totally non-sexual and pure silly humor. That's about all I can remember that has anything remotely to do with sex.

Edit: I also don't think the target audience was children at all. More like childish adults. Kids don't get nostalgic over 8-bit games.
body_html:
What the fuck. If people are rule34'ing undertale, okay whatever... they're gross and I wouldn't be surprised if the fanbase was full of pedos since they're on reddit, but have you played the game?

There's a dog couple that are in love and the skeleton that you can flirt with is totally non-sexual and pure silly humor. That's about all I can remember that has anything remotely to do with sex.

Edit: I also don't think the target audience was children at all. More like childish adults. Kids don't get nostalgic over 8-bit games.

body: I haven't. That's why there's a question mark in ny title. I've only seen snippets of actual gameplay. I got the impression that you could flirt with everyone, (in part because of all the fanfic/art.) It still seems pretty weird, and seems to have a theme of tolerance towards monsters, i.e. it puts you in a situation with a violent aggressor, but rewards players for not fighting? Why set the game up as a dungeon crawler when its really a tween relationship simulator unless you're trying to say something?

body:
uh....no? looney toones and old disney movies have more sexual content in it than undertale does. remember when Bugs Bunny crossdressed and Elmer Fudd wanted to fuck him?

you remind me of those parents from the 90s who thought magic the gathering and DnD were about demonic worship and witchcraft. 

calm down, Tipper

body:
I'm formulating my opinion based in part on the INSANE reaction people seem to have to this game, which is what lead me to think that there is something especially fucked about this game. I have watched some gameplay as well. 

According to the fanbase, merely questioning its greatness *is* an unpopular opinion.

body: I don't know anything about the creator, I get the impression he's just a random dude, but the mythology he's (perhaps inadvertently) tapped in to seems to resonate in a particular way with a particular crowd. That's not to say anyone that likes it is weird or crazy, on the surface of it, its just a very story driven old school RPG with some interesting mechanics. But it seems to engender a freakishly obsessive reaction in certain unbalanced individuals.
